speaker: Waystone
lines: The stone stands with its lichen coat buttoned to the throat.
Carvings hide under green, patient as seeds under snow.
Someone pressed a palm here long ago and forgot to take the warmth back.
A crow feather tucks into a crack like a bookmark.
A thread of red wraps the baseâ€”a ribbon or a vein.
The air tilts when you speak near it. It prefers listening.
If you close your eyes, you can hear the ring counting to eleven.
If you open them, something else closes.

choices.text: Lay your hand where warmth waits.
Break the ribbon and see who comes.
Tie your own ribbon and leave quietly.
